ca.mcgill.ecse211.mountev3rest.util

Class ArmController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.mountev3rest.util.ArmController

  • public class ArmController
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a set of methods to perform the basic subtasks required for ring collection. Among the facilities provided by the ArmController class are ring identification, and ring retrieval.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ArmController(EV3MediumRegulatedMotor colorSensorMotor, EV3MediumRegulatedMotor armMotor, EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor, EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor, Navigation navigation, ColorDetector colorDetector)
      Creates an ArmController that will operate on the provided motors.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void getRing()
      Gets a ring from the tree face that the robot is looking at when the method is called.
      void releaseRing()
      Releases the ring being carried by the robot on the arm if any.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • ArmController

        public ArmController(EV3MediumRegulatedMotor colorSensorMotor,
                     EV3MediumRegulatedMotor armMotor,
                     EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor,
                     EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor,
                     Navigation navigation,
                     ColorDetector colorDetector)
        Creates an ArmController that will operate on the provided motors.
        Parameters:
        colorSensorMotor - Motor that will be used to control the light sensor.
        armMotor - Motor that will be used to control movement of the arm's claw.
        leftMotor - Left motor used to displace the robot.
        rightMotor - Right motor used to displace the robot.
        navigation - Navigation object used to move the robot the robot to different points on the grid.
        colorDetector - Object used to classify the reading of the light sensor into colors.
        See Also:
        ColorDetector

    • Method Detail

      • getRing

        public void getRing()
        Gets a ring from the tree face that the robot is looking at when the method is called. This method assumes that the robot is already properly aligned with the corresponding tree face. A number of beeps is produced before the ring is grabbed corresponding to the color of the ring as defined by the ColorDetector's encoding.
        See Also:
        ColorDetector

      • releaseRing

        public void releaseRing()
        Releases the ring being carried by the robot on the arm if any.
